newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU vets German aviation goods merger.
newsitem.headline: EU vets German aviation goods merger.

text.p: The European Commission said on Thursday it was reviewing plans by aviation equipment company Bodenseewerk Geraetetechnik BmbH (BGT) to acquire 50 percent of AEG Infrarot-Module GmbH (AIM).
BGT, a unit of the Diehl Group, would purchase shares from EHG Elektroholding GmbH, which belongs to the Daimler-Benz Group and has been the sole owner of AIM.
AIM produces sensor components and modules for heat-sensitive cameras and search equipment for aircraft.
The Commission said the deal appeared to fall under European Union rules giving it the power to vet mergers that could create or strengthen a dominant position.
It has one month to clear the linkup or open an in-depth investigation. -- Brussels newsroom, 322 287 6800
